Package org.example

Class Library

java.lang.Object
org.example.Library
public class Library extends Object
Michael Ramirez, Software Development I, CEN 3024C, November 24, 2024 Class: Library This Class has been replaced with BookCollection Class. This class represents the Library Management System (LMS). It manages a collection of books by adding, removing, listing, checking in/out books saving, and loading books from a file. The class uses a TreeMap to store the collection of books, where each book has a unique ID/barcode, and books can be manipulated based on title or ID/barcode.

  • Method Details

    • addBooksFromFile

      public String addBooksFromFile(String filename)
      Loads books from a specified text file. Each line in the file must contain a book's ID, title, and author, separated by commas.
      Parameters:
      filename - the file path to load the books from
      Returns:
      toString messages

    • removeBook

      public String removeBook(String id)
      Removes a book from the collection by its book barcode.
      Parameters:
      id - the barcode of the book to remove
      Returns:
      messages.toString()

    • removeBookByTitle

      public String removeBookByTitle(String title)
      Removes a book from the collection by its Title.
      Parameters:
      title - the name of the book to remove
      Returns:
      messages.toString()

      public String checkOut(String title)

      public String checkIn(String title)

    • listBooks

      public String listBooks()
      Lists all books in the collection. Displays the book ID along with the book's details.
      Returns:
      toString bookList

    • saveCollection

      public String saveCollection(String filename)
      Saves the current collection of books to a file. Each book is saved in CSV format (ID, title, author).
      Parameters:
      filename - the file path where the collection will be saved
      Returns:
      messages.toString()

    • loadCollection

      public String loadCollection(String filename)
      Loads the book collection from a file. The file must contain lines in the format: ID,title,author.
      Parameters:
      filename - the file path from which to load the collection
      Returns:
      messages.toString()
